lines.text:
[Opening intertitle]
Every town has its "Bim" ____ the idol of its youths and bane of its elders.

[Laying in the hayloft watching two others pitching hay]
You guys work so hard I get tired watchin' you.

[Looking for a free meal with Bill]
Hello, chef___anything we can do for you today?
'sassinate dem poultry fo' me an' you both eats.

[Looking at the town gossips talking about Bill and him]
If talk was a breeze, kid, that bunch would be a cyclone.

[to Bim]
They ain't nothin' the matter with you, is there? You didn't go to school, did you? Then why in hell send me?

[Oft repeated line]
The law'll take care of this.
